actions.text: Committee on Foreign Relations ordered to be reported an original measure.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Lugar with a preamble. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 477.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Senate agreed to companion measure H.CON.RES. 239 in lieu of this measure by Voice Vote.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

official_title: An original concurrent resolution commending the Government of Ireland and the Government of the United Kingdom for reaching agreement on measures which will lay the foundation for a just, durable, and peaceful solution to the problems of Northern Ireland.

summary.text: Declares that the Congress commends the Government of Ireland and the Government of the United Kingdom for their achievement for peace in Northern Ireland. Declares Congress' willingness to work with the President in supporting the Anglo-Irish agreement through U.S. economic support and in promoting economic and social development in both parts of Ireland.

titles.title: An original concurrent resolution commending the Government of Ireland and the Government of the United Kingdom for reaching agreement on measures which will lay the foundation for a just, durable, and peaceful solution to the problems of Northern Ireland.
